DOC.brief_title: A Randomized Trial Economic Incentives Promote Walking Among Full Time Employees
DOC.detailed_description: The first part study comprise in-home face-to-face survey 950 full-time employee Singapore . The survey aim identify optimal programme might look like quantify potential uptake programme , offer . Stated preference conjoint analysis , assess individual preference attribute specific programme , use . The second part study Randomised Controlled Trial ( RCT ) 12-month walk programme . Up 800 full-time employee recruit allocate one four research arm : Control Group , Programme Only Group , Cash Incentive Group Charitable Incentive Group . Participants intervention arm ask track physical activity use Fitbit Zip , wireless pedometer , automatically uploads data custom website . Those incentive arm earn money raise money charity meet weekly exercise target . Those control Programme Only group receive weekly payment participation . Incentives participation payment provide month 1 - 6 , withdrawn . The key outcome variable RCT define bout ( minute ) moderate vigorous physical activity ( `` MVPA bout '' ) measure via accelerometry . Data collect baseline month 6 12 assessment . Findings RCT also use determine cost employer implement programme incremental cost-effectiveness incentive programme compare basic programme without incentive . The primary hypothesis basic programme low cost per person cash charity programme , incentive programme cost-effective relative less expensive less effective basic programme .
